Dear Lauren Skinner:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing on the CWL-4617 within 15 days with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617 the
recommendation will be treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a
provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action plan. If you
desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.5159
Section Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Description restraints; elimination of restraints.
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member improperly restrained a youth and during the
restraint, it appeared that the staff member kneed the youth in his
abdomen or thigh area. The youth has a mark on the right
forearm.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 6/25/2025 and did
not provide any additional information.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face in her residence alongside
MDHHS Specialist on 7/10/2025. Staff 5 reported Youth A was
acting out and she was attempting to redirect him. Staff 5 reported
Youth A was running around, throwing french fries at her and hit
her in the arm with a cord leaving a mark on her left forearm.
During the time of the interview Staff 5 showed her forearm to the
consultant and MDHHS Specialist, there were no visible marks.
Staff 5 reported she was working to de-escalate him by talking to
him and asking him to put his shoes on so they could go outside.
Staff 5 reported he threatened to “beat her fucking ass.” Staff 5
reported Youth A then punched her in the face at which point she
attempted to restrain him. Staff 5 reported she dropped what she
was holding so she could restrain him properly after initially
grabbing only one arm due to holding a binder in her other arm at
the time. Staff 5 reported she grabbed both of Youth A’s arms and
put them in front of him. Staff 5 reported Youth A was continuing
to try to kick her and bite her on the arm and on her right breast
while in the restraint. Staff 5 reported asking Staff 4 to call for a
supervisor, so Staff 4 took Staff 5’s walkie and called for a
supervisor. Staff 5 reported other staff being present, however, did
not recall who was there. Staff 5 could not recall if any other youth
were present. Staff 5 denied any of the present staff attempting to
2

assist her. Staff 5 reported at one point during the restraint she did
put her knee up against Youth A’s back from behind him to lean
Youth A back as this is what she was taught so he could not kick
her. Staff 5 denied causing harm or injury to Youth A, denied
observing any marks or bruises on Youth A, and denied Youth A
complaining of pain. Staff 5 reported when Supervisor
approached, she was swearing at Staff 5 and Youth A saying “ya’ll
getting on my fucking nerves, I ain’t doing this shit.” Staff 5
reported Supervisor told her to let go of Youth A even though he
was still at high speed, meaning he was still attempting to attack
her. Staff 5 reported releasing Youth A and going to the stairs.
Staff 5 reported when she went downstairs, she asked Supervisor
and Manager if she could go home and was threatened with
suspension if she did. Staff 5 reported continuing to work in the
same area as Youth A after the incident.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 6/26/2025 and on 7/11/2025. Supervisor
reported being called upstairs for assistance. Supervisor reported
clearing out kids from the area as she approached by verbally
telling them to leave the area. Supervisor reported directing Staff 5
to release Youth A from the restraint due to the restraint being
done incorrectly. Supervisor reported the restraint was incorrect
because Staff 5 was in front of him, holding his arms and for the
restraint she was attempting to do she should have been behind
him. Supervisor denied seeing Staff 5 restrain prior to this attempt.
Supervisor reported seeing a bruise on Youth A’s arm, Supervisor
could not recall which arm it was. Supervisor denied observing or
being aware of Staff 5 having any marks or injuries following the
incident. Supervisor reported Staff 5 was moved to another area
immediately following the incident to not be working with Youth A.
Supervisor denied Staff 5 asking her if she could go home.
Supervisor reported Staff 5 said to her “I can go home if you all
want me to.” Supervisor denied knowledge of any threats of
suspension if she did go home. Supervisor denied cursing or
using any other inappropriate language before or during the
incident. Supervisor denied restraining Youth A, stating she
blocked him from leaving the hallway to go after Staff 5.
Supervisor reported directing all other youth and staff present to
leave the area while she came forward to direct Youth A.
Supervisor reported Youth B was present for part of the situation.
Supervisor reported Staff 2 was present and was not able to recall
which other staff were present at the time.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 6/26/2025 and on 7/28/2025. Staff 2
reported Youth A was not following directives and Staff 5 was
going back and forth with him verbally. Staff 2 reported Youth A
3

was walking into rooms, so Staff 5 was losing line of sight of him
and was directing him to come back out. Staff 2 reported Staff 5
attempted to stop him from going into another room from the
hallway by getting in front of him and he swung at her trying to hit
her. Staff 2 reported he believed Youth A did hit her in the face.
Staff 2 reported Staff 5 then attempted to restrain Youth A
incorrectly with his hands behind his back. Staff 2 reported
attempting to direct her on how to adjust to do it properly. Staff 2
reported the second attempt she had him facing the right way but
he was against the wall which is also incorrect. Staff 2 reported it
was then when Supervisor came and directed Staff 5 to let go of
Youth A. Staff 2 reported Staff 5 walked out of the hall to the
stairwell. Staff 2 denied seeing what occurred with Youth A after
this stating Supervisor moved towards him to speak with him and
directed everyone out of the area. Staff 2 denied observing any
marks or injuries on Youth A or Staff 5 and denied Youth A and
Staff 5 complaining of pain or injury. Staff 2 could not if any other
youth were present. Staff 2 identified Staff 5, Staff 3, and
Supervisor to be the staff present during the incident. Staff 2
denied any past concerns while working with Staff 5.
Staff 2 reported as Supervisor approached to assist, she said “y’all
are irritating me” followed by directing Staff 5 to release Youth A.
Staff 2 denied anything else being said and denied Supervisor
cursing or using inappropriate language. Staff 2 denied Staff 5
complaining of pain or asking to go home. Staff 2 reported Staff 5
was moved to another area away from Youth A after the incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 6/26/2025 and on 7/28/2025 via telephone.
Staff 3 reported Staff 5 was trying to restrain Youth A because
Youth A was trying to physically attack Staff 5 by swinging his
arms at her to try to punch her. Staff 3 reported Staff 5 was
struggling with the restraint but could not recall what was wrong
with it or how she was doing it. Staff 3 denied recalling viewing
any marks or bruises for Youth A or for Staff 5 or either Staff 5 or
Youth A complaining of any pain. Staff 3 reported Supervisor
came to the floor to assist. Staff 3 denied remembering who else
was around. Staff 3 denied there was any inappropriate language
or cursing at the time Supervisor came to assist. Staff 3 denied
awareness of Staff 5 asking to go home or being told she could
not go home. Staff 3 reported Staff 5 was moved away from Youth
A following the incident.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 6/26/2025. Youth B reported Youth A was
acting up by throwing objects and going into other youth’s
bedrooms so Staff 5 was telling him to stop. Youth B denied
4

seeing anyone including Staff 5 restrain Youth A. Youth B
reported being told to leave the hallway. Youth B denied recalling
who instructed him to leave the hallway. Youth B denied hearing
what either Youth A, Staff 5, or Supervisor said. Youth B denied
any other youth being in the hallway when Youth A began to act
out. Youth B could not recall what staff were in the hallway other
than Staff 5.
Youth A was interviewed on 7/11/2025 face-to-face at the facility.
Youth A denied remembering what happened with Staff 5. Youth
A denied remembering who Staff 5 was or being restrained in the
hallway by the bedrooms. Youth A denied being injured or having
any marks or bruises. No visible marks were viewed during the
interview.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/11/2025.
Director denied awareness of Staff 5 asking to go home, being
told she could not, or being threatened with suspension if she did
go home after the incident. Director denied awareness of
Supervisor cursing or using inappropriate language when
approaching to assist. Director denied awareness of Staff 5 being
injured, having marks, or reporting being injured following the
incident. Director reported Staff 5 was moved to a different area
from Youth A following the incident.
Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/11/2025.
Manager denied Staff 5 asking to go home after the incident and
denied any knowledge of anyone else or herself stating Staff 5
would be suspended if she went home. Manager denied
knowledge of Staff 5 having marks, bruises, or bite marks
following the incident. Manager reported she spoke with Staff 5 on
the phone after the incident and reiterated she is to continue to be
switched out of the area and not working near Youth A. Manager
denied seeing any marks on Staff 5 when she saw her in person
following the incident. Manager denied knowledge of Supervisor
cursing or using any inappropriate language upon approaching the
hallway to assist.
Documentation Review:
• Incident Report (IR) dated 6/23/25 authored by Supervisor
states Youth A was put into a high standing restraint due to
client being physically aggressive towards staff. IR documents
Youth A threw food, hit staff with a cord, and punched Staff 5
in the face. IR states verbal redirection was given. IR states
staff was switched out. IR documents Youth A was injured
during the restraint sustaining a bruise on right middle arm.
5

• Photo of Youth A’s right middle arm with visible red marks
near the elbow.
• Human Resources File for Staff 5 documents 2 suspensions
due to unrelated infractions of attendance and sleeping while
on duty. File documents training hours totaling 65 hours
including CPI training.
• Prohibited Interventions Policy states use of interventions that
will cause personal discomfort outside of the appropriate
interventions trained in CPI are prohibited.
• Behavior Support and Management Policy allows for Children
Control position to be utilized.
Video Footage:
• Video footage from 6/23/25 of the 2nd floor hallway was
viewed. The view is partially obstructed by ductwork and an
open door. There are at least three other staff present with
Staff 5. Staff 5 can be seen backing up when Youth A jumps
and swings his right arm at Staff 5’s face. Two staff are still
present. One staff seems to attempt to assist but backs away
once Staff 5 attempts to restrain Youth A with her back to the
camera and Youth A is out of view. No other staff make any
attempt to assist or stop Staff 5. At 1 minute 20 seconds Staff
5 drops the binder out of her left arm to adjust her grip on
Youth A. Staff 5 appears to have Youth A in a restraint when
they back up behind the door. Youth A is seen with his back to
Staff 5 with his arms crossed in front of him while Staff 5 holds
his wrists in front of his neck. At 1 minute 53 seconds Youth A
is moved towards the wall by Staff 5 where he is held for
several seconds as he attempts to kick Staff 5. At 2 minutes
and 20 seconds Staff 5’s right knee can be seen positioned
against Youth A’s back who is between her knee and the wall.
At 2 minutes 26 seconds Supervisor is seen entering the
hallway from the stairwell. Staff 5 releases Youth A and exits
the hallway through the same door Supervisor entered.
Supervisor positions herself between the exit and Youth A.
Youth A attempts to run to either side of Supervisor to get by
her and Supervisor uses her arm to catch the youth, she is
seen wrapping her arm around him to grab him and moving
him in front of her multiple times. At 2 minutes 56 seconds
Supervisor allows Youth A to go to the exit and Youth A and
Supervisor proceed through the door to the stairwell.
Analysis A rule violation is established regarding this allegation. It is
supported by interviews and video footage. Staff 5 utilized
inappropriate restraint techniques with Youth A by restraining
Youth A against the wall, positioning Youth A to face her rather
than away from her, as well as using her knee against his back
6

and holding Youth A’s arms across his neck. Further, the other
staff present at the time of the restraint did not assist Staff 5 with
the restraint which could have prevented the unsafe restraint.
Technical Assistance:
Language needs to be added to the Behavior Support and
Management Policy that while an improper restraint is occurring
staff in the vicinity need to step in and provide direct assistance.
Consultation:
It is recommended the facility add language on incident reports to
document support or follow-up provided to staff who were
potentially injured during an incident.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Additional finding of non-compliance
Type
Allegation Supervisor utilized inappropriate restraint techniques by grabbing
the youth and pushing him back.
Investigation Interviews:
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 6/26/2025 and on 7/11/2025. Supervisor
reported being called upstairs for assistance. Supervisor reported
clearing out kids from the area as she approached by verbally
telling them to leave the area. Supervisor reported directing Staff 5
to release Youth A from the restraint due to the restraint being
done incorrectly. Supervisor denied restraining Youth A, stating
she blocked him from leaving the hallway with her body to go after
Staff 5. Supervisor reported directing all other youth and staff
present to leave the area while she came forward to direct Youth
A in the hallway.
7

Documentation Review:
• Human Resources File for Supervisor documents 1
disciplinary infraction related to attendance. File documents
over 142 training hours including Child Management and CPI.
• Prohibited Interventions Policy states use of interventions that
will cause personal discomfort outside of the appropriate
interventions trained in CPI are prohibited.
Video Footage:
• At 2 minutes 26 seconds Supervisor is seen entering the
hallway from the stairwell. Staff 5 releases Youth A and exits
the hallway through the same door Supervisor entered.
Supervisor positions herself between the exit and Youth A.
Youth A attempts to run to either side of Supervisor to get by
her and Supervisor uses her arm to catch the youth, she is
seen wrapping her arm around him to grab him and pulling
him toward the front of her multiple times. At 2 minutes 56
seconds Supervisor allows Youth A to go to the exit and Youth
A and Supervisor proceed through the door to the stairwell.
Analysis An additional finding of noncompliance is established. In video
footage Supervisor uses her arm to wrap around grab Youth A
and physically pull him in front of her.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
